abstract: bioRxiv 3848 biorxiv BIORXIV bioRxiv 2692-8205 Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Preprints PMC12478412 PMC12478412.1 12478412 12478412 41031013 10.1101/2025.04.23.650120 1 preprint 1 Article Niche Macrophages Recycle Iron to Tumor Cells and Foster Erythroblast Mimicry to Promote Bone Metastasis and Anemia Han Yujiao Sarkar Hirak Xu Zhan Lopez-Darwin Sereno Wei Yong Hang Xiang Liu Fengshuo Tran Kimberley Wang Wei Miller Jennifer M. DeCoste Christina J. Blohm Dylan Satcher Robert L. Zhang Xiang H.-F. Kang Yibin 26 4 2025 497784 2025.04.23.650120 29 09 2025 30 09 2025 01 10 2025 http://biorxiv.org/lookup/doi/10.1101/2025.04.23.650120 nihpp-2025.04.23.650120.pdf Abstract Bone marrow is both a primary site for blood cell production and a fertile niche for metastatic cancer cell growth, notably in breast cancer. Although anemia is common among patients with bone metastasis, the mechanistic link between metastatic colonization and disrupted erythropoiesis remains poorly understood.
